To fix Wire, try doing an uninstall then reinstall on your phone when Wire nuts up (message delivery & notifications) AND AFTER EVERY MAJOR ANDROID OS UPDATE, then go into "devices" in Wire and delete all the other copies of your phone. Major Andoid OS updates seem to mess with the security keys in Wire and it then thinks the phone is a different phone, so copies accumulate in "devices" like floor wax, which seems to confuse Wire. The reinstall will create a current device, it seems.

replyText:
We appreciate the time taken to provide this feedback. The new app is running on a completely new code base, which enables better performance and more reliability. For users to benefit from the enhanced stability, we had to disable a few features that are loved by our users, however they will all come back soon.

Wire Support Team
text: This app has gone to hell. Features that USED to exist and work and now either broke or got removed ever since they did their revamp: - Audio calls - Video calls on desktop - Texting on desktop - Texting while calling - Calling tones - Notifications - Pings - Sending more than one photo at a time - Choosing your own theme (now forced coordination with your device's theme) - Sending location // all new features are stupid, dont force release a half baked pile of trash on your poor users.
